titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Karl Owen Thompson Collection
titlestmt.author: compiled by Manuscripts and Archives Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 10:41

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: A collection of approximately one hundred letters relating to Yale University. Included are letters by five Yale presidents, Yale faculty members, and letters received by George E. Day of the Divinity School. Also an essay in Latin written in 1859 by A. W. Van Hengel.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Karl Owen Thompson Collection (MS 1217). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Karl Owen Thompson Collection contains a small selection of approximately one hundred letters relating to Yale University. Included are letters by five Yale presidents, Yale faculty members, and faculty members of the Divinity School, as well as letters received by George E. Day of the Divinity School. There are also letters of recommendation and other correspondence of Yale interest. The only items in the collection which are not correspondence are the 1859 passport of George E. Day and a memoir written by Professor A. W. Van Hengel of the University of Leyden in 1859.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown, though much of the material in this collection is likely in the public domain. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

did.unittitle: Letters of recommendation and. other impersonal communications of Yale interest
Van Hengel, A.W.: Memoir in Latin written by him in Leyden
